intro: Paris hamifer, commonly known as the lesser mouse-ear, is a small perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, white flowers that bloom in early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to gardens and a valuable component of natural ecosystems.
